title.rendered: Paris Fashion Air Takes Flight, Elevating the Paris Fashion Scene

content.rendered:
Paris Fashion Air Takes Flight, Elevating the Paris Fashion Scene

Paris, France [October 3, 2023] The Paris fashion scene recently witnessed a spectacular launch as Paris Fashion Air (PFA) soared onto the scene, introducing a fresh platform for creativity and innovation. Curated by the visionary Veronika Jeanvie, PFA successfully unveiled its inaugural season within the iconic walls of La Maison de L'Amrique Latine.

This enchanting venue transformed into a vibrant fashion hub, hosting six exceptional designers who unveiled their collections at the PFA Platform showroom. The esteemed lineup featured Arunaz, Savage&Hunt, DMD Brand, Naz Maer, Hanna.Stu.Art, and Margot VII, each bringing their unique and captivating creations to the forefront.

The opening day of the event welcomed a parade of renowned designers who flew to Paris to present their collections. This star-studded lineup included Reemami (UAE), Manuel Tiscareno (USA), Lucas Anderi (Brazil), Naz Maer (France), and Hian Tjen (Indonesia). Followed by Savage&Hunt (UK), Karunas, Arunaz (Kazakhstan), Andre Tan (Ukraine), and Diana Muza of DMD Brand (UAE), this fashion spectacle set new standards in the industry.

Adding an artistic touch to the event, MAAP UP ART ACADEMY PARIS proudly served as the official makeup team sponsor.

Beyond fashion, the event also celebrated the world of art. A dedicated space was set aside for art enthusiasts, featuring Alexa Dmina's masterfully handcrafted tapestries exploring the theme of nomadic peoples, alongside Natasha Burenina's thought-provoking artworks created using artificial intelligence. The inclusion of Mari Skakun, an expressionist artist, performer, educator, and art therapist, further enriched the artistic tapestry of the event.

However, one of the most heartwarming moments during these two captivating days was the Charity Dinner hosted by designer Veronika Jeanvie. This event aimed to support orphaned children affected by the conflict in Ukraine. Veronika presented her wedding gowns collection, "Art of Peace," dedicated to addressing the changes and challenges facing our world today, while passionately advocating for peace and global unity. The models were impeccably styled by makeup artist Mariia Anosova.

The Charity Dinner also featured an auction of prestigious wine brands, with all proceeds contributing to the noble cause.

With its promising debut, PFA is poised to become a thriving community for creative minds, designers, and artists to showcase their talents, forge new collaborations, and expand their business horizons. Paris Fashion Air has truly taken flight, breathing fresh air into the world of fashion and art.

Runway Looks

Arunaz

Hian Tjen

Karunas

Muza

Savage&Hunt


Photo: Press Paris Fashion Air

More on: @parisfashionair


By Senior Fashion Editor 24FashionTV: Christina V Henningstad @christina_henningstad
